Legal_Issue: Credibility of applicant in refugee claim
Credibility_Assessment: Found not credible due to inconsistencies, omissions, and evasive responses
Legal_Provision: Section 96, IRPA - Basis for refugee protection
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility issues including omission of key events and lack of supporting evidence
Proceeding_Type: Refugee hearing followed by judicial review
Application_Error: Omission of material facts at port of entry and in testimony
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decisions
Application_Factor: Applicant's profile and alleged persecution history
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board erred in credibility assessment
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 101(1)(a) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility, inconsistencies in testimony, omission of key events
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent testimony, lack of corroboration, unexplained gaps
Procedural_Fairness: Assessed as met by the Board
Credibility_Issues: Omission of key events at port of entry, evasive answers, peaceful coexistence with LTTE
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to Board's credibility finding on judicial review
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative tribunal decision
Omission_Type: Failure to disclose material events during initial screening
